Cost of Printer Rentals for Remote Work

June 30, 2025 Marga Enterprises

Understanding the Cost of Printer Rentals for Remote Work

Remote work is here to stay. With more professionals setting up home offices, one question often arises: How much does it cost to rent a printer for remote work? Whether you’re a freelancer, a remote employee, or a business providing equipment for your distributed team, understanding the cost of printer rentals for remote work is crucial for budgeting, productivity, and sustainability.

In this blog post, we’ll explore the cost factors, options available, and tips to find the right rental setup—while keeping your expenses low and your output efficient.

Why Rent a Printer for Remote Work?

Remote workers often find that they still need hard copies—for contracts, signed documents, or even simple drafts for review. However, buying a new printer for every home office can be costly and inefficient. Renting offers a practical solution.

Benefits of printer rentals for remote setups:

  • Lower upfront cost

  • Regular maintenance included

  • Flexibility to upgrade

  • Support for eco-friendly printing

What Affects the Cost of Printer Rentals?

The cost of printer rentals for remote work varies depending on several factors. Knowing these can help you decide whether a monthly rental plan fits your needs and budget.

1. Printer Type and Features

Basic inkjet printers are cheaper to rent, while multifunction laser printers with scanning, faxing, and wireless connectivity cost more.

  • Basic inkjet models: ₱500–₱1,000/month

  • Laser printers with advanced features: ₱1,500–₱3,500/month

  • Multifunction color copiers: ₱4,000/month and up

If you only print a few pages a day, go for simpler models. But if you need high-volume printing, investing in a higher-tier rental makes more sense.

2. Contract Duration

Most providers offer monthly rentals, but committing to a 6-month or 12-month contract often brings down the price.

  • Month-to-month: Flexible but slightly more expensive

  • Long-term contract: Cost-effective with fixed pricing

3. Location and Delivery

Remote areas may require additional fees for delivery and setup. Always ask the provider if transportation and pickup are included in the quote.

Hidden Costs to Consider

Before finalizing a printer rental, check for these often-overlooked costs:

  • Ink or toner replacements: Are they included?

  • Paper supply: Most plans don’t include this.

  • Maintenance: Most rentals include servicing, but check the response time.

  • Overage charges: If your usage exceeds the agreed page count, you might incur extra fees.

Eco-Friendly Rentals: Save Cost and the Environment

Many remote professionals now seek environmentally conscious options—not just to save the planet but also to reduce long-term expenses.

Choosing an eco-friendly printer rental can reduce your energy bills and waste output. Here are a few reasons why:

  • Energy-efficient printers use less electricity. Learn more here.

  • Recyclable components and cartridges cut down on landfill waste. Explore recycling programs.

  • Eco-certified machines ensure compliance with global environmental standards. Read about certifications.

  • Sustainable materials help reduce harmful emissions. Check options here.

Choosing sustainability doesn't just benefit the environment—it can also mean cost savings over time through reduced power usage and longer-lasting materials.

Cost Comparison: Rental vs. Purchase

FeatureRentingBuying
Upfront CostLow or noneHigh
MaintenanceUsually includedBuyer’s responsibility
FlexibilityHigh (upgrade anytime)Low (stuck with what you buy)
Ideal for Remote TeamsYesNot ideal
Long-term CostDepends on usageCheaper if used for years

For most remote workers or small businesses supporting a hybrid setup, renting makes more financial sense—especially when usage is light to moderate.

How to Choose the Right Rental Plan

Before signing a rental agreement, ask these important questions:

  1. How many pages do you print monthly?

  2. Do you need color printing or just black-and-white?

  3. Do you need scanning or wireless functions?

  4. What’s included in the rental package (ink, maintenance, etc.)?

  5. Is the printer energy-efficient or eco-certified?

You can also explore guides like this cost breakdown of eco-friendly printer rentals to make a smarter decision.

Additional Tips to Lower Printer Rental Costs

Here are some ways to keep costs down when renting a printer for remote work:

  • Share with a household member if they also work from home.

  • Monitor your printing habits and avoid waste.

  • Use duplex (double-sided) printing to reduce paper usage.

  • Subscribe to refill services instead of buying cartridges individually.

  • Join providers that offer loyalty or volume discounts for long-term customers.

Final Thoughts: Is Printer Rental Worth It for Remote Workers?

Absolutely—if you choose wisely.

Renting gives you the freedom to print without the burden of hardware maintenance, high upfront costs, or dealing with breakdowns. It also lets you upgrade as your needs grow.

And if sustainability matters to you, choosing eco-friendly printer rentals makes it easier to align with your values without sacrificing performance.

Explore eco-conscious options and read customer reviews of eco-friendly printers here.

Ready to Rent?

If you’re setting up a productive and sustainable home office, renting the right printer can save you time, money, and stress. Make sure to choose a provider that offers transparent pricing, energy-efficient models, and responsive support.

Let your remote workspace be smarter, greener, and more efficient—starting with your printer rental choice.
